name: py-darshan

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Python utilities to interact with Darshan log records of HPC
applications.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pytest-runner
dependencies.description: Invoke py.test as distutils command with dependency resolution.

dependencies.name: py-cffi
dependencies.description: Foreign Function Interface for Python calling C code

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-matplotlib
dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.

dependencies.name: py-seaborn
dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependencies.name: py-mako
dependencies.description:
A super-fast templating language that borrows the best ideas from the
existing templating languages.

dependencies.name: py-humanize
dependencies.description:
This modest package contains various common humanization utilities, like
turning a number into a fuzzy human readable duration ('3 minutes ago')
or into a human readable size or throughput. It works with python 2.7
and 3.3 and is localized to Russian, French, Korean and Slovak.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: darshan-util
dependencies.description:
Darshan (util) is collection of tools for parsing and summarizing log
files produced by Darshan (runtime) instrumentation. This package is
typically installed on systems (front-end) where you intend to analyze
log files produced by Darshan (runtime).

dependent_to.name: drishti
dependent_to.description:
Drishti is a command-line tool to guide end-users in optimizing I/O in
their applications by detecting typical I/O performance pitfalls and
providing a set of recommendations.
